page.title: 08GAMES CHILDREN PLAY
page.content: CHILDREN IN THIS AREA PLAY MANY TEAM GAMES SUCH AS CRICKET, FOOTBALL AND ROUNDERS. THERE ARE MANY DERIVATIONS FROM TWO OTHER BASIC GAMES. HIDE AND SEEK IS KNOWN AS POM-POM AND THE CHILDREN HAVE A HOME BASE TO RETURN TO. THE WORDS POM-POM ONE-TWO-THREE ARE USED FOR BOTH CAPTURE AND RELEASE. TIN TAN TOPPER IS THE SAME GAME USING A BALL AS A HOME BASE. THREE VARIETIES OF CHASE AND ONE OF TAG ARE ALSO PLAYED AND ARE KNOWN AS BRITISH BULLDOG, DUCK, POLO AND STICK-IN-THE-MUD RESPECTIVELY. MORE INDIVIDUAL GAMES INCLUDE HOPSCOTCH, JACKS, SNOOKER, SWING BALL AND THE USE OF COMPUTER GAMES. TWO TYPES OF SKIPPING ARE PLAYED, FRENCH SKIPPING WHICH USES ELASTIC ROUND THE ANKLES AND INDIVIDUAL USE OF ROPES.
